title: Searching for old Keen program
content:
Long long ago, I played a (IIRC freeware) game which was the first game I was introduced to after Dangerous Dave. I simply *loved* it, but my PC crashed and I was never able to recover the files from it. I really really want to get it back. I have seen the (screenshots of the) official Keen games, but it was none of them, I'm sure. This game I was playing had this boy jumping around on a pogo stick, squelching turtles (Mario-like) and things like that and the graphics was simply awesome!

I've search the net a lot to find this program but can't. Please help me! I really hope you can.

title: Re: Searching for old Keen program
content: Sorry, never heard of that game nor seen it.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]  Sounds fun though. I'm sure it wasn't any Keen fan game either, at least haven't heard of anything like that.[url=http://www.keengrid.net/]keengrid.net[/url]

title: Re: Searching for old Keen program
content:
1. Thanks for the welcomes and the replies.
2. It was DOS.
3. It was not a dream.
4. I know Jazz Jackrabbit, and this game was not certainly it. Loved it (both) though! ...
